topics.body:
Why do we see dinosaurs as extremely aggressive and will kill anything on sight?
I mean, we get it that they were predatory animals (well, most of them), but so what?
There are many predatory animals these days and they aren't even close to as aggressive as people expect from dinosaurs, either from science shows or Jurassic Park movies. The dinosaurs people expect were basically sharks, but much worse.

Why no dinosaurs that are a bit passive like today's animals?
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557ad5e26368720a55005b58#post_557ad5e26368720a55005b58
Because they haven't learned to fear us,

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557ad5e26368720a55005b58#post_557ad5e26368720a55005b58

topics.body:
"@AppleJackFrost":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557ae71363687265e20012f8#post_557ae71363687265e20012f8
Phantasmagoria of Flower View; the story is essentially *ALL* the main characters are competing to be the hero this time to be the hero who solves the mystery of why Gensokyo is being overrun by so many god damn flowers all over the place and accidentally getting onto Yuuka's fields.

Heroes, "I'll be the hero this time!"
Yuuka, "Get off my god damn lawn!"
Hero, "Or what?"
Yuuka, "*sadistic grin* What don't you stick around and find out?"

topics.body:
Oh!  OH!  News and good news in fact!

Gawker vs Hulk Hogan is going to be concluded July 6th; for those of you that don't know Gawker media is being sued for illegally procuring a sex tape of Hulk Hogan and they're being sued for $100,000,000.  The thing is though that they're almost certainly going to lose the court case at this point.

What does this mean?  Even if they have to pay just a fraction of it they'll have to sell the company.
